Description: Marl pottery jar with flat base, sides expanding to a rounded shoulder, flat everted rim. Exterior upper shoulder is decorated in deep red paint with four bands of wavy lines and a band of solid triangles. Lower body is undecorated, trimmed with a knife.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D59b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
